availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen Nethercutt (Carter County farmhand and soldier)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Virginia native. Son of George W. Nethercutt and Rebecca Wells Nethercutt. Resident of Carter County in 1850. Farmhand in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain from January 10, 1862 to May 18, 1864. Promoted to first lieutenant in February 1863. Promoted to captain in February 1864. Resigned on May 18, 1864. Served in the Carter County Militia (Kentucky National Legion) as a lieutenant in 1865.
